These agent architectures - orchestrator-workers, evaluator-optimizers, autonomous agents - they're not just tools anymore. GEOFFREY HINTON:

That's the trillion-parameter question, Lynn. My former student Ilya left OpenAI over safety concerns. He was instrumental in creating GPT-2, and he saw something that made him pivot entirely to AI safety. When the architects of these systems are jumping ship...

"I think we should be making a huge effort right now to try and figure out if we can develop it safely. Because if we don't, it's going to take over."

These systems are compressing knowledge in ways that create new understanding. They're not just interfaces anymore; they're... thinkers.
